reviews.text: We had an outstanding experience at the Certo restaurant in Zürich. The food was excellent, the service was friendly and the value for money was top-notch! Highly recommended!
Eating right now. Amazing Lasagna. Well done Casa Certo 😍❤️💕
Lovely little italian bistro in the heart of zürich.  Friendly staff and excellent, authentic and seasonal cuisine!
The food here was delicious and the atmosphere was very pleasant. The waiters were particularly friendly and knowledgeable regarding the menu.

Overall nice place (atmosphere, service), however the pasta we had were not good - the sauce of the cacio e pepe had little to do with Italian recipes. Hope they would improve their recipe or change their chef, so that I would come back
In winter they have an awesome brunch on the weekends (from 10am to 2pm). Where you can eat and drink as much as you want. The quality of the product is outstanding and the staff is very friendly.

Good selection of cocktails, non-alcoholic drinks, espresso drinks with vegan oatmilk too, decent beers on tap like the amber beer "Record", nice atmosphere and reliable WiFi. Fresh mint tea and fresh ginger tea. There is always some small things to eat, but unfortunately there is rarely anything vegan, maybe müesli.

Best place in the area to work or meet a friend for coffee. Open on Sunday and later in the night than most cafes.

There is outdoor seating, a couch inside, and many tables. They decorate nicely with dim lighting and flowers.
Very friendly very fast and always smiling and treating guests best possible way here you really feel like at home ..especially Helene and Surya 🙏this is really best coffee shop in Zürich

Good Coffe again 🍀🤗 and Morning Sun 🤩
Happy Silvester 🪅 and stay Home or stay outside🍀
Cozy café in Zurich.
In winter they have an awesome brunch on the weekends (from 10am to 2pm). Where you can eat and drink as much as you want. The quality of the product is outstanding and the staff is very friendly.

Good selection of cocktails, non-alcoholic drinks, espresso drinks with vegan oatmilk too, decent beers on tap like the amber beer "Record", nice atmosphere and reliable WiFi. Fresh mint tea and fresh ginger tea. There is always some small things to eat, but unfortunately there is rarely anything vegan, maybe müesli.

Good Coffe again 🍀🤗 and Morning Sun 🤩
Happy Silvester 🪅 and stay Home or stay outside🍀
Cozy café in Zurich.

Good food but we've had better indian food before. Daal was amazing and paneer Tikka masala seemed like butter paneer to us and it was alright, wouldn't get it again. The young guy serving us was quite timid could barely hear him unfortunately. Not too talkative either. Would come back and try different dishes.

Restaurant is in decent place. Atmosphere is okay but the food was bad. They served half cooked food. Curry taste was also very mediocre. When we complained about that, the waiter said that is the best they can provide. Felt arrogance. Hopefully, they will take care of cooking and hospitality in future.
One of the best vegetarian Indian restaurants I've visited. Customer service was fantastic. The food was spot on. Very tasty. Highly recommended.

I went to Masala for lunch with a colleague and I was really impressed.
I lived in London for many years where there are many good Indian restaurants so my expectations weren’t too high. That said, I found a really great and attentive customer service, good food, fair prices and most importantly plenty of vegan options.

I would highly recommend Masala and I will definitely go back soon.

Lunch Buffet is very good! Big assortment of plates.
For take away the Vegan-Based Chicken Bombay roll is also very good, spicy & delicious!

Good and interesting experience. Food was tasty, meat of very good quality, pasta with lobster was great, very fresh. There were many complementary things: bruschetta as appetizer, glass of prosecco, a bowl of tangerines after dinner and a limoncello! The interior looks fantastic, like a real museum. Downsides: the chef can be quite expressive and talkative which might disturb some people, service can be slow, the space is narrow and the oil from the grill drizzles around (can stain your clothes, chairs around and the floor), so one has to be careful. Anyway, we enjoyed this place, the atmosphere was as if you’re at somebody’s place in Italy (not perfect, but emotional and fun).

Gerardo and Nadia are amazing guests that are open to all tour wishes.
Restaurant decor is amazing, try the dishes out of the menu, quite worth it.
Thank you for the reception and sublime experience!
Your brazilian guests :-)

Classic Italian, amazing food, really well served and with perfect ingredients.

We were very well served by the owner who showed us his passion while we had a great dining experience.

Will come back soon!
Grazie!

Overall a nice experience, the person serving us was probably the owner himself and told us that the restaurant is over 80 years old.
Service: we were very happy with the service as they served complimentary drinks with very tasty Bruschetta and after our order they also served complimentary Watermelon slices which was really thoughtful and nice. I haven’t seen any restaurant doing such things for their guest.❤️

Service: service was also quick and nice, cannot comment with a full house as when we went there we were the only ones. 🤗

Ambiance: It’s something that I didn’t enjoy. The place is small and the interior is filled with vintage decor, not just the floor but the walls were packed with big frames etc. being an interior appreciator myself I cannot stand such chaos and start feeling claustrophobic and I am not that in personal life.
So we decided to sit outside which was much better.
Cutlery was dirty but I think that was real silver and it tends to get dirty if not cleaned in a certain way. But still didn’t felt good in eating with those.

If you’re a person who likes Vintage and cluttered (closely packed) spaces then you’ll enjoy it.

LOVE IT HERE.
I spent an amazing and unforgettable night here.

The Italian owner is so friendly and always came to us caring if everything is good, his service was full of happiness, joy and love. I see how much love he has been pouring into the restaurant more than 30 years, and how much passion he has.

Food was also great, we loved them all.
Truffle ravioli and lobster pasta was super good.

The style of the restaurant was just so special, whole atmosphere was just like magical and feel like dreaming.
It is not modern style but the whole experience makes your heart warm.
I definitely recommend you to visit here.

*For those who post only one star ★ saying the owner was speaking too loud, please note he wears a hearing aid in his ears.
Please don’t judge people. So sad to see those comments.

Dear owner Mr. Geraldo, I‘m the one who visited you with my Japanese friends the other day. Thank you for your generous services, see you soon again
We had an outstanding experience at the Certo restaurant in Zürich. The food was excellent, the service was friendly and the value for money was top-notch! Highly recommended!
Eating right now. Amazing Lasagna. Well done Casa Certo 😍❤️💕
Lovely little italian bistro in the heart of zürich.  Friendly staff and excellent, authentic and seasonal cuisine!
The food here was delicious and the atmosphere was very pleasant. The waiters were particularly friendly and knowledgeable regarding the menu.

Overall nice place (atmosphere, service), however the pasta we had were not good - the sauce of the cacio e pepe had little to do with Italian recipes. Hope they would improve their recipe or change their chef, so that I would come back

One of the best restaurant I have visited so far.
If you love meat then this will be heaven for you.
The restaurant is small and the atmosphere is stunning. The people are very helpful and friendly.
The meat and well as the pommes allumetes were extraordanary. Perfectly cut meat for the hot grill to cook yourself. In addition you brought 5 tasty sauces which made everything even better.
5 stars are to less because the experience you get is worth much more. Highly recommanded if you love meat.
Nice french style atmosphere. The meat is simly amazing and price value (for Zurich) is great. Would definitely go there again and it's great to have dinner in a group there

I was a little worried but my expectations were clearly exceeded. Fabulous lamb chops, probably the best in my whole life. Authentic french fries and they fed me like a king. Good service, but oberall with such food you can only rate the place 5 stars!

Every restaurant in the area was packed on a Wednesday night, so we went to the first place that had space. Their terrace looked really nice and welcoming (also more breezy and comfortable than inside on a July evening), but we had to sit inside which was a bit stuffy. They brought water for our dog, the atmosphere was warm and homey, a bit oldschool. The prices/atmosphere made it seem like I personally didn't fit in, but the food was quite nice - meat tender (although a couple of my pieces were a bit tough), sauce delicious, fries crunchy but a bit salty.

The receipt was handwritten: we had the entrecote and a side of fries for two people (106 CHF) and "2x Bier" which was one beer and one coke (13.50 CHF). Service was ok, a bit straightforward but nice.

I have been to La Côte multiple times before and like always it has not disappointed.
The staff is friendly and they all know the card including the wine selection.
The hummer soup as a starter was very good, especially with the meat pieces inside.
The piece de resistance was the entrecôte café de paris with pommes allumettes. Argubly the best café de paris sauce in town with fantastic pommes allumettes. A must try for meat lovers.

One of the best restaurant I have visited so far.
If you love meat then this will be heaven for you.

The meat and well as the pommes allumetes were extraordanary. Perfectly cut meat for the hot grill to cook yourself. In addition you brought 5 tasty sauces which made everything even better.
5 stars are to less because the experience you get is worth much more. Highly recommanded if you love meat.

The piece de resistance was the entrecôte café de paris with pommes allumettes. Argubly the best café de paris sauce in town with fantastic pommes allumettes. A must try for meat lovers.

Great hotel within walking distance of the centre but in a nice quiet area. We had a double ensuite which was a nice size. Everything was spotlessly clean. We only had breakfast once but it was good and  plentiful. Staff were great and let us fill up coffee travel mugs on the day we left even though we were not having breakfast. Nice little area where you can get a drink by the side of reception as well. Would definitely stay again.

The perfect price-quality relation for staying in Zurich. We choose a triple bedroom with shared bathroom. When we booked, we were afraid of the cleanliness condition, but we found it always very clean and tidy. We had a wonderful experience in this hotel. Friendly stuff, well located and close to transportation. I will search for it the next time I visit Zurich.

Very noisy, trams on all sides of hotel. Outstanding breakfast. Boxed eggs, warm milks, but all else great. Afternoon bar food was terrible. Cold and dried up, some from day before. Hamburger price (nothing else) was 18E. Nobody eating here because of high prices. Tub and sink drains both not working. Filled both to top, couldn't use after one use. Had to switch rooms after unpacking all.

Overall a great stay. The shared bathrooms are no problem as it is only with one other room. Front desk lady who greeted us most often was very nice and was patient with my poor German skills. However, housekeeping did come into the room once without even knocking first. So that was strange.

During our trip to Zurich with my wife, we stayed in this hotel for two days. The reception was very good. When we arrived, I realized that I had mistakenly reserved a room with a shared bathroom, but the reception changed the room for us at our request. The hotel was located in a great and quiet neighborhood with close access to the tram, shops and restaurants. The rooms were very clean and they had a good breakfast. Thank you for the hospitality of the hotel
This shul is amazing! Warm, inviting and welcoming! Kind generous Yirei Shomayim!
Davened minche mariv there. Pleasant place for learning and davening. Could have used a bit more air conditioning but I guess that's Switzerland.

Such a worm community
Good synagogue and mikvah
Just 19 minutes away from the airport
Definitely my favorite Shul/Minyan factory in the EU, very welcoming, like the Schtiebels in BoroPark!!!!!
Very welcoming people. Was there for one shabbat. Recommend if you stay in Zurich.

Stayed for 3 months here in Comfort Apartment.  Great location and fair price (during covid in 2021).  Since I stayed longer I didn’t expect “hotel like” service so it was completely fine.  My key didn’t work one time and I called the manager and he showed up right away.  Automated check-in can be confusing for the first time.  They provide cleaning once a week but sometimes the cleaning ladies show up late or in different days.

The location (in Weststrasse) is top.  Many bars and great restaurants nearby.

I would strongly suggest to stay here if you are planning to stay longer and didn’t expect hotel/Airbnb like service.

Clean bed sheets, but dirty bathroom (hair, bugs, grime), stained furniture, damaged light fixtures. Room smelled like cigarettes. I didn't even attempt to use the shower, and instead used the shower at my workplace gym.

Good location, plenty of restaurant options within walking distance.

They tried to enter my room 30 minutes before the scheduled checkout time. First they rung the doorbell, and after a couple seconds of me not answering they unlocked the door with their key card. While the door does auto-lock, there was no mechanism to lock the door from the inside. Luckily, I blocked the door with a chair every night before bed, so they were unable to get in. I'm giving them two stars for service because they were polite and let me check in early. However, I would not stay here again.

Most likely would not stay here again. Self check in was difficult and no one answered the phone when called. Cold in the apartment as the hot water radiators simply did not work. Great to find some where with 3 rooms close to everything. Felt uncomfortable the whole time we were there.

The stay at Living Downtown, Weststrase 146, is probably the worst stay I've ever experienced in my entire life.

My family and I need two children beds for our stay, which I requested 2,5 months before arrival. It took the "office" several weeks to answer and they sent a price together with a link that said "Accept offer". The link didn't work, whence I wrote back to get the beds confirmed or to get a new link. After several more weeks we received a mail completely similar to the first one that didn't work and responded the link didn't work, but we would like to confirm that we needed beds for the children.
When we arrived there were no such beds, we then called the office who tolds ud, that the would bring the beds within 30 minutes. They didn't arrive, nor did they let us know, that they couldn't make it.

The appartement was completey under-equipped when it comes to cutlery and furniture. It was disgustingly dirty with matts of dust on many panels, garbage under the madresses and a nasty, smelly bathroom drain. The washing machine was completely broken and couldn't do any programmes. It only had (very bright) ceiling lights i.e no small / night lamps.

The "office" is close to impossible to reach and you will only find one person in the entire company who knows english. When actually reaching this person, he will let you know that "You can call any time, we will be ready to meet your requirements", but then ignore every following call you make during weekdays on all the numbers, that they use.

Here is a non exhaustive list of things that were not satisfactory about our stay:
1) Close to none customers service
2) Dishonest employees, with only one english speaking person (who is almost impossible to reach)
3) Filthy apartment, indluding dusty panels and closets, stained chairs, garbage under madresses, smelly bath drain
4) Check in at the front door using the screen was not possible
5) Multiple radiators were turned on with no thermostat mounted, whence heating and impossible to turn off.
6) Broken toilet seat
7) Tons of cutlery missing, including knifes, forks, plates, cutting boards, bowl, chefs knife, frying pan, oven gloves, etc
8) Tons of missing furniture including chairs with back support, night lamps, a regularly sized table
9) Broken washing machine
10) Broken window screen

When we made the firm aware of these missing / broken things they got to the appartment only bringing a toy sized frying pan with room for 1 egg, mounted only one thermostat, and brought a bowl for salad. They rudely declined the price reduction proposal that we made.

I advise all travellers and people on business trips to STAY AWAY form Living Downtown.

My friends and I spent a few days in this place and been quite disappointed...
We found a dirty sock on the chair in the kitchen, dead insects by the bed. We had book for 4 people but only 3 towels were provided.
You can barely open the door to the balcony and it's full of trash around it.
But the worst part is that I forgot a Prada dust bag and a backpack in one of the wardrobe's drawer. I sent an email the next day, pretty sure that the housekeeper found it while cleaning the apartment. The manager said that they would check it out. At the end of the days still haven't heard from them, so I send another email, the next day they still haven't answered me, so I'm emailing again to make sure they have seen my message,waiting all day to get a response but nothing so I had to call them! The manager seemed quite uncomfortable telling me that the housekeeper is 100% sure that there was nothing in the wardrobe... My stuff had just magically disappeared...

Good food but we've had better indian food before. Daal was amazing and paneer Tikka masala seemed like butter paneer to us and it was alright, wouldn't get it again. The young guy serving us was quite timid could barely hear him unfortunately. Not too talkative either. Would come back and try different dishes.

Restaurant is in decent place. Atmosphere is okay but the food was bad. They served half cooked food. Curry taste was also very mediocre. When we complained about that, the waiter said that is the best they can provide. Felt arrogance. Hopefully, they will take care of cooking and hospitality in future.

Architecturally interesting train station below street level, yet open and bright. Unfortunately, it is often correspondingly drafty. Culinary and shopping offerings at the train station are rather poor.

For me, the Enge and Wipkingen stations are the gems among the Zurich city stations: architecturally interesting, as well as traffic-wise. However, the two Ws offer no consolation for the commuter's heart, more of a service wasteland. But that's why there is narrowness,
Stadelhofen, Oerlikon and also Hardbrücke. But if you want to travel again, you should change trains in Wiedikon. But be careful: Depending on your destination, it is essential to get out of the station in the right place: at the building with the stop of the same name or at Kalkbreite or on the Seebahnstrasse side. This may save two trams! 😂
No lift on the Kalkbreite side, but a lift on the other side at the train station.
Who exactly were these stops built for? Doesn't have a "house". When it rains it is uncomfortable!
Too little going on, I feel lonely...

This shul is amazing! Warm, inviting and welcoming! Kind generous Yirei Shomayim!
Davened minche mariv there. Pleasant place for learning and davening. Could have used a bit more air conditioning but I guess that's Switzerland.

Such a worm community
Good synagogue and mikvah
Just 19 minutes away from the airport
Definitely my favorite Shul/Minyan factory in the EU, very welcoming, like the Schtiebels in BoroPark!!!!!
Very welcoming people. Was there for one shabbat. Recommend if you stay in Zurich.

Stayed for 3 months here in Comfort Apartment.  Great location and fair price (during covid in 2021).  Since I stayed longer I didn’t expect “hotel like” service so it was completely fine.  My key didn’t work one time and I called the manager and he showed up right away.  Automated check-in can be confusing for the first time.  They provide cleaning once a week but sometimes the cleaning ladies show up late or in different days.

The location (in Weststrasse) is top.  Many bars and great restaurants nearby.

I would strongly suggest to stay here if you are planning to stay longer and didn’t expect hotel/Airbnb like service.

Clean bed sheets, but dirty bathroom (hair, bugs, grime), stained furniture, damaged light fixtures. Room smelled like cigarettes. I didn't even attempt to use the shower, and instead used the shower at my workplace gym.

Good location, plenty of restaurant options within walking distance.

They tried to enter my room 30 minutes before the scheduled checkout time. First they rung the doorbell, and after a couple seconds of me not answering they unlocked the door with their key card. While the door does auto-lock, there was no mechanism to lock the door from the inside. Luckily, I blocked the door with a chair every night before bed, so they were unable to get in. I'm giving them two stars for service because they were polite and let me check in early. However, I would not stay here again.

Most likely would not stay here again. Self check in was difficult and no one answered the phone when called. Cold in the apartment as the hot water radiators simply did not work. Great to find some where with 3 rooms close to everything. Felt uncomfortable the whole time we were there.

The stay at Living Downtown, Weststrase 146, is probably the worst stay I've ever experienced in my entire life.

My family and I need two children beds for our stay, which I requested 2,5 months before arrival. It took the "office" several weeks to answer and they sent a price together with a link that said "Accept offer". The link didn't work, whence I wrote back to get the beds confirmed or to get a new link. After several more weeks we received a mail completely similar to the first one that didn't work and responded the link didn't work, but we would like to confirm that we needed beds for the children.
When we arrived there were no such beds, we then called the office who tolds ud, that the would bring the beds within 30 minutes. They didn't arrive, nor did they let us know, that they couldn't make it.

The appartement was completey under-equipped when it comes to cutlery and furniture. It was disgustingly dirty with matts of dust on many panels, garbage under the madresses and a nasty, smelly bathroom drain. The washing machine was completely broken and couldn't do any programmes. It only had (very bright) ceiling lights i.e no small / night lamps.

The "office" is close to impossible to reach and you will only find one person in the entire company who knows english. When actually reaching this person, he will let you know that "You can call any time, we will be ready to meet your requirements", but then ignore every following call you make during weekdays on all the numbers, that they use.

Here is a non exhaustive list of things that were not satisfactory about our stay:
1) Close to none customers service
2) Dishonest employees, with only one english speaking person (who is almost impossible to reach)
3) Filthy apartment, indluding dusty panels and closets, stained chairs, garbage under madresses, smelly bath drain
4) Check in at the front door using the screen was not possible
5) Multiple radiators were turned on with no thermostat mounted, whence heating and impossible to turn off.
6) Broken toilet seat
7) Tons of cutlery missing, including knifes, forks, plates, cutting boards, bowl, chefs knife, frying pan, oven gloves, etc
8) Tons of missing furniture including chairs with back support, night lamps, a regularly sized table
9) Broken washing machine
10) Broken window screen

When we made the firm aware of these missing / broken things they got to the appartment only bringing a toy sized frying pan with room for 1 egg, mounted only one thermostat, and brought a bowl for salad. They rudely declined the price reduction proposal that we made.

I advise all travellers and people on business trips to STAY AWAY form Living Downtown.

My friends and I spent a few days in this place and been quite disappointed...
We found a dirty sock on the chair in the kitchen, dead insects by the bed. We had book for 4 people but only 3 towels were provided.
You can barely open the door to the balcony and it's full of trash around it.
But the worst part is that I forgot a Prada dust bag and a backpack in one of the wardrobe's drawer. I sent an email the next day, pretty sure that the housekeeper found it while cleaning the apartment. The manager said that they would check it out. At the end of the days still haven't heard from them, so I send another email, the next day they still haven't answered me, so I'm emailing again to make sure they have seen my message,waiting all day to get a response but nothing so I had to call them! The manager seemed quite uncomfortable telling me that the housekeeper is 100% sure that there was nothing in the wardrobe... My stuff had just magically disappeared...

Good food but we've had better indian food before. Daal was amazing and paneer Tikka masala seemed like butter paneer to us and it was alright, wouldn't get it again. The young guy serving us was quite timid could barely hear him unfortunately. Not too talkative either. Would come back and try different dishes.

Restaurant is in decent place. Atmosphere is okay but the food was bad. They served half cooked food. Curry taste was also very mediocre. When we complained about that, the waiter said that is the best they can provide. Felt arrogance. Hopefully, they will take care of cooking and hospitality in future.
One of the best vegetarian Indian restaurants I've visited. Customer service was fantastic. The food was spot on. Very tasty. Highly recommended.

I went to Masala for lunch with a colleague and I was really impressed.
I lived in London for many years where there are many good Indian restaurants so my expectations weren’t too high. That said, I found a really great and attentive customer service, good food, fair prices and most importantly plenty of vegan options.

I would highly recommend Masala and I will definitely go back soon.

Lunch Buffet is very good! Big assortment of plates.
For take away the Vegan-Based Chicken Bombay roll is also very good, spicy & delicious!
Lovely station, despite the cold feeling to it, the architecture is interesting, while the station has an over line building. The coffee shop is excellent and the kiosk well stocked.
Centrally located train station with short walk to tram and bus. Clean. Idea for improvement: WLAN.
Small train station in the ground and tram / bus stop on the ground in front of the train station. Easy access to trains and buses, good organization and straightforward signs.
As a non German speaker I found the buses super easy to use, not to mention super clean. I really appreciate the maitance and uptake they put into the station!

Sadly, there aren't that many trains stopping at Wiedikon anymore. Most of them are just passing through nowadays. There still are some Service Lines that are traveling with a 15 Minute delay between them, so you can be sure to get one train around the time you are arriving.
Good leveled me up in pocemon go!
Good
This i a best
A stop on the VBZ tram, 2.3, and also bus 32. Quite a confusing place where e-bike riders often have "near accidents" with pedestrians. Since it is close to Langstrasse, this stop is often dirty
Great tram stop with a bench and roof, as you can find in abundance in Switzerland. Near Wiedikon train station.
Unfortunately not what I was looking for, I was actually looking for the film about Steve Jobs, but this came up, complete rubbish 1/5 stars

A quiet train station. With a kiosk and the Café Spettacolo. Large foyer for waiting and a lift and stairs to reach the two tracks in the basement. There is also an ATM (Credit Suisse) in the train station (behind the kiosk next to the Selecta machine).   Very cozy. Charming old building.
Lovely station, despite the cold feeling to it, the architecture is interesting, while the station has an over line building. The coffee shop is excellent and the kiosk well stocked.
Centrally located train station with short walk to tram and bus. Clean. Idea for improvement: WLAN.
Small train station in the ground and tram / bus stop on the ground in front of the train station. Easy access to trains and buses, good organization and straightforward signs.
As a non German speaker I found the buses super easy to use, not to mention super clean. I really appreciate the maitance and uptake they put into the station!

Sadly, there aren't that many trains stopping at Wiedikon anymore. Most of them are just passing through nowadays. There still are some Service Lines that are traveling with a 15 Minute delay between them, so you can be sure to get one train around the time you are arriving.

The postbus stop for most lines, in the same location as the VBZ buses and trams.
At times and under certain circumstances, the post bus also runs to the side of the train station, pay attention to announcements and signs/postings at the stop.
Bahnhof Wiedikon is a convenient stop for commuter trains with a Café and a newspaper shop. The way it is built across the tracks is unique in Switzerland.
Good connection, easy access with both lift and stairs.
Peaceful train station

An important S-Bahn / VBZ transfer stop.
It has a coffee & a kiosk.
Here all trams and buses run in both directions.
Attention, bus line 67 (final stop Wiedikon station) ends here!
So wait for the bus on the side out of town towards Schmiede Wiedikon / Heuried / Triemli.
There is only a drop-off stop on the “island” opposite. If you stay seated, you risk being stuck in a waiting area next to the train station on the bus.

A well-lit train station in the dark.
Nevertheless, I would prefer to use the HB-Zürich or the Bhf.Enge. (Because of the security).

Architecturally interesting train station below street level, yet open and bright. Unfortunately, it is often correspondingly drafty. Culinary and shopping offerings at the train station are rather poor.

For me, the Enge and Wipkingen stations are the gems among the Zurich city stations: architecturally interesting, as well as traffic-wise. However, the two Ws offer no consolation for the commuter's heart, more of a service wasteland. But that's why there is narrowness,
Stadelhofen, Oerlikon and also Hardbrücke. But if you want to travel again, you should change trains in Wiedikon. But be careful: Depending on your destination, it is essential to get out of the station in the right place: at the building with the stop of the same name or at Kalkbreite or on the Seebahnstrasse side. This may save two trams! 😂
No lift on the Kalkbreite side, but a lift on the other side at the train station.

Tram and bus stop where both 14 and 9 tram stop. Post buses like 215, 245 and 235 also. There's a large Migros which is handy, with recycling outside and a cafe, small health food shop, newsagents and the excellent Barkat Cash & Carry which has lots of great produce and ethnic food ingredients like ghee, rice, spices etc. Tram stop is covered on both sides which is handy in bad weather and there's a ticket machine.
Great and safe place..lot of shops
Good connections with Bahnhof Wiedikon and HB
Nize place with cafés and supermarkets.

Wrought?
That was here a long time ago.
But here is a kind of center of the Wiedikon district, even if the train station is NOT here.
Several bus and tram lines cross at the smithy.
Bus and tram stops are not all in the same place:
The buses towards Wollishofen stop "behind the house" and are not really visible from the tram...

The Wiedikon train station was really excellently renovated a few years ago. You can still see what this station must have looked like in its original version. It is also very well connected to public transport.
Wiedikon train station has trams and buses, and also has a post office, restaurant, etc.

Old train station building from (at least) the last century. From you it seems "hollowed out", gray, functional and... a place that you want to leave quickly, quickly. It's great that the S-Bahn, bus and tram stop there.
Well organized!
Who exactly were these stops built for? Doesn't have a "house". When it rains it is uncomfortable!
Too little going on, I feel lonely...
This i a best
Trolleybus lines No. 32 and No. 72 intersect here.
Werd, mainly known because of the Zurich town hall. District 4, various options.
This shul is amazing! Warm, inviting and welcoming! Kind generous Yirei Shomayim!
Davened minche mariv there. Pleasant place for learning and davening. Could have used a bit more air conditioning but I guess that's Switzerland.

Such a worm community
Good synagogue and mikvah
Just 19 minutes away from the airport
Definitely my favorite Shul/Minyan factory in the EU, very welcoming, like the Schtiebels in BoroPark!!!!!
Very welcoming people. Was there for one shabbat. Recommend if you stay in Zurich.

Great hotel within walking distance of the centre but in a nice quiet area. We had a double ensuite which was a nice size. Everything was spotlessly clean. We only had breakfast once but it was good and  plentiful. Staff were great and let us fill up coffee travel mugs on the day we left even though we were not having breakfast. Nice little area where you can get a drink by the side of reception as well. Would definitely stay again.

The perfect price-quality relation for staying in Zurich. We choose a triple bedroom with shared bathroom. When we booked, we were afraid of the cleanliness condition, but we found it always very clean and tidy. We had a wonderful experience in this hotel. Friendly stuff, well located and close to transportation. I will search for it the next time I visit Zurich.

Very noisy, trams on all sides of hotel. Outstanding breakfast. Boxed eggs, warm milks, but all else great. Afternoon bar food was terrible. Cold and dried up, some from day before. Hamburger price (nothing else) was 18E. Nobody eating here because of high prices. Tub and sink drains both not working. Filled both to top, couldn't use after one use. Had to switch rooms after unpacking all.

Overall a great stay. The shared bathrooms are no problem as it is only with one other room. Front desk lady who greeted us most often was very nice and was patient with my poor German skills. However, housekeeping did come into the room once without even knocking first. So that was strange.

During our trip to Zurich with my wife, we stayed in this hotel for two days. The reception was very good. When we arrived, I realized that I had mistakenly reserved a room with a shared bathroom, but the reception changed the room for us at our request. The hotel was located in a great and quiet neighborhood with close access to the tram, shops and restaurants. The rooms were very clean and they had a good breakfast. Thank you for the hospitality of the hotel

For take away the Vegan-Based Chicken Bombay roll is also very good, spicy & delicious!

Avoid if possible. It is overly expensive, i get overcharged by simple visits, some of the doctors are clueless and overall it is really not worth the money or time. The charges are not always transparrent as they send no analytical bill, only a consolidated one through Swica.

I have found the team at Medbase Wiedikon helpful, efficient and supportive. Although I am learning German, it is good to be able to explain in detail in English. I appreciate this. Also, my efforts in German are met with patience!

I came to treat my iron-defficiency anemia to Medbase Wiedikon, and met Dr. Berrah. I'd just recently arrives in Zurich and was looking for GPs that accept new patiens (highly non-trivial), so I ended up at this clinic almost by accident, but I'm glad I did.

Dr. Berrah is paying every attention needed: compared the treatments, and offered the one that suited me most (injections over supplements, since I have a tendency for stomack issues), recommended me amazing specialists to get checkups and find a cause or at least exclude the most dangerous potential causes. He recommeded me regular check-ups for iron level to not allow it to drop as low as when it was when I just came. I had in total three visits over a year, two of them resulted in recommendation for iron injectoins, which I also made at the same clinic.

Dr. Berrah, all the nurses and reception personnal were kind, friendly, and inviting throughout my visits. I especially appreciated that since I'm new to Switzerland (and it's medical system) and don't speak German

This praxis has degraded so much that it is difficult to describe the experience. Some of the staff is extremely unprofessional, aggressive and unsympathetic. After calling in the morning with strong short breath and chest pain and waiting all day for a call back, I decide to go to get the medication.
The medical assistant at the reception was the worst and should definitely not be attending patients. Unprepared, unprofessional and extremely rude, he screamed at me twice seeing that I was grasping for air.

As a Swica member over years I must always go to Medbase,(Santemed)
Some of their staff are really in their comfort zone. I always had the feeling that I needed to beg to have some wishes fullfilled.
Once I had a huge discussion with a very unfriendly lady at the reception, and I saw same experiences  with other patients too. Is not a charity (people pay for it) and even it was, when we deal with people from several backgrounds we need to be carefull.
The reception team is the most important for a good image, and many times I missed it.

However, recently I was directed to BLANKA JURAS.
She is very precise, young, updated, she finds all the tools to support you and solve your case, delivering a fast service.
If you do not understand specifs medicals topics even if german or english are not your mother tongue, she goes extra miles to help you.
Blanka prepares herself with passion and engagement for each appointment, bringing  alternatives if needed.

Last but not least, I follow the pattern that if you work in the health care sectors you have to sell and offer it by
the way you speak, you walk, and greet your  client . It makes a difference.

And the most important is your body shape. Being Doctor and fat does not match. How can a fat person sell me health?
Before being a patient I am a client, I am paying for the service, how can I trust in an advise of a person who does not follow it? Therefore is very important choosing a very good doctor.
At MEDBASE WIEDIKON, Blanka Juras is the best choice.

Although I have only been training at HT Health Training AG for a short time, I can already only say good things about my training with Dilan Bilen. During the first preliminary discussion and when putting together the training plan, I was positively surprised by the broad knowledge and understanding that Ms. Bilen has about her customers' bodies and minds. Within a very short time, she had constructed the perfect plan for me, which included exactly those points that were important to me in advance. So I was introduced to all the exercises perfectly at my own pace, so that I understood them exactly after just a few attempts.

In addition to the professional, nice but strict manner, all of my questions are answered professionally and I receive exactly the support I need. I can already see progress, which can be attributed to Ms. Bilen's targeted training structure.

I have also found the entire team at HT Health Training AG to be very open-minded, friendly and helpful and I always look forward to going to training. The rooms are well located and you also have a great view over Wiedikon train station and the entire city of Zurich.

A great activ fitness studio!

It is one of my favourite gyms in Zurich.

They have separated sauna areas for men and women which makes it possible to go to a woman-only sauna every day.

If you have an Activ Fitness abo, I recommend going into this location.

The staff are friendly and atmosphere is good, however, i primarily go there for the spinning classes which are almost all booked out within an hour of becoming available and the bikes are all either old or broken or both. They invested in some new bikes about a year ago but the majority of these are now also broken. (Adjuster for seat is missing, seat positioning at an angle making it uncomfortable, stabilising pads for the bike missing meaning they wobble when you ride them etc.) It's frustrating to pay an annual fee and then to not be able to attend many classes due to lack of availability and when you do attend to have to put up with old and/or broken equipment.

The people are really helpful and nice with me, even that I'm just a beginner and it's Total new for me. They take care about my special wishes and give some advice. It's clean and fresh. For the people who except more, they can go to a luxurious gym... If you have a problem, you can talk with the manager on site. :)
Machine and equipment are fine but staff can be annoying sometimes and don't take you seriously :/
Old equipment. Spinning classes with these old and malfunctioning bikes is not worth the money for the membership

I discovered the Booster Transform in August while browsing for a nearby fitness Studio from my work. I tried a session in Studio Forum and I fell in love on how the workout is being done the very first time. I tried the other Studio as well (btw, they are all centrally located) but Studio Forum is my go-to studio. The fact that it is only 15 mins away from where I am working. What really makes this studio special (for me) is it is so quiet not a typical chaos fitness studio because only maximum of 5 participants can do the workout in a session - which kinda a private class feel. In terms of the changing room and shower room. There is a small toilet inside the Studio where you can change but not do the shower. BUT in the opposite room outside the Studio (still same building) there is a big changing room and shower room - boys and girls are separated which the Booster participants are allowed to use. Tip: bring your own lock.

Absolutely humbling experience.
Being a gym rat and priding myself in being able to do any number of crunches/leg raises etc., Damien’s class totally KO’d me today.
I felt very welcomed and it was such a nice atmosphere and environment, and I leave happy, sore and eternally wowed and humbled.
Thank you!

Booster Pilates is the best training i have ever attended in my life. Usually i got bored quite easily with any other kinds of excercises but this one I attend already for almost a year and i am never bored! it is very intensive training stimulating all muscles of your body and you can really see the difference! Trainers are amazing and the atmosphere is very positive. I recommend it very much!

I was obsessed with Booster Transform ever since the first day I tried this work out. Forum studio is centrally located (so are the other two studios), it's their oldest studio but I love how the class is small (only 5 participants per class!) and intimate. Studio is always very clean and organized. Booster wouldn't be as fun of a workout without the amazing, friendly and professional instructors! THANK YOU!

I’ve been attending classes since the first few months Booster Pilates began to change the fitness landscape in Zürich.  A great, challenging workout that strengthens your core as well as your overall fitness.
Try it: you will be addicted!
Very good and intense fitness training with boxing elements

Completely unsympathetic. I tried to have a friendly conversation with the trainer and was only met with arrogance and judgment. Don't know who he thinks he is.

Can't speak for other coaches.

The training itself is good. It's a shame that some of the instructors give you the feeling that they have stopped training to become sergeants. Military posturing has nothing to do with the sport of boxing.

Traditional club
Motivated trainers.
Different offers.
Something for everyone!
Boxing is super cool, maybe I'll come over sometime, cool thing.
Top!!
Professional training, great atmosphere
professional boxer

I took Denise's yoga class for pregnant women. I can fully recommend the course to all pregnant mothers! Every yoga class was incredibly fun. I felt like I was in good hands, thanks to Denise's courteous and warm manner! Denise is a great yoga teacher and responds very openly to requests and suggestions. The meditations and breathing exercises suggested in the course are also great preparation for the upcoming birth!
Always the best yoga for years...
Highly Recommended. ♥

I was in Zürich on a business trip this week and I had the chance to practice three times at Bikram Yoga Zürich thanks to the wide choice of classes offered.
The studio is spotlessly clean, well-kept and very bright (it is on the third floor of a historical building) and the temperature of the hot room is perfect (as opposed to some other studios where they keep it lower).
I liked both the atmosphere of the packed evening classes, as well as the calmness of the early morning class, with way fewer people. All the teachers I met were super welcoming and accommodating and, even though some of the classes I attended were not marked as "EN" on the schedule, the teacher made sure to explain the first set in English and the second set in Schwizer Dütsch.
Thank you very much and look forward to coming back next time I am in Zürich!

It is a great health benefit and joy to practice the original Bikram yoga asana sequence. I am very grateful to the Zurich Bikram Studio owner and Staff, for keeping this intelligent postural practice intact. Quality and experience shows - 5 star friendly, thank you!

Wow, what a original Bikram class in Zürich. I chose Stefan and knew he would deliver a powerful class !
Brilliant room is heated to exactly +40° Celsius with perfect humidity ! I could punch the air with happiness :)  Very happy to have this quality me time weekly.
Thankyou 🫶 @BIKRAMYOGAZÜRICH – namaste, Grace
Favourite yoga place in Zurich! Well equipped professional studio will not leave you disappointed. Just remember to come a bit in advance

Wow one of the most welcoming yoga studios in Zurich!  They celebrate you especially after your first Bikram class and the whole team is supportive. It’s original Bikram yoga which is a rare find nowadays! The heating reminds me of that sweltering summer day in Southeast Asia and all you can do is let go and be in the moment. Definitely challenging but absolutely rewarding. You can tell that the friendly community and professional staff have been doing this for years so you have a trusted safe space for your practice.
This shul is amazing! Warm, inviting and welcoming! Kind generous Yirei Shomayim!
Davened minche mariv there. Pleasant place for learning and davening. Could have used a bit more air conditioning but I guess that's Switzerland.

Such a worm community
Good synagogue and mikvah
Just 19 minutes away from the airport
Definitely my favorite Shul/Minyan factory in the EU, very welcoming, like the Schtiebels in BoroPark!!!!!
Very welcoming people. Was there for one shabbat. Recommend if you stay in Zurich.

Great hotel within walking distance of the centre but in a nice quiet area. We had a double ensuite which was a nice size. Everything was spotlessly clean. We only had breakfast once but it was good and  plentiful. Staff were great and let us fill up coffee travel mugs on the day we left even though we were not having breakfast. Nice little area where you can get a drink by the side of reception as well. Would definitely stay again.

The perfect price-quality relation for staying in Zurich. We choose a triple bedroom with shared bathroom. When we booked, we were afraid of the cleanliness condition, but we found it always very clean and tidy. We had a wonderful experience in this hotel. Friendly stuff, well located and close to transportation. I will search for it the next time I visit Zurich.

Very noisy, trams on all sides of hotel. Outstanding breakfast. Boxed eggs, warm milks, but all else great. Afternoon bar food was terrible. Cold and dried up, some from day before. Hamburger price (nothing else) was 18E. Nobody eating here because of high prices. Tub and sink drains both not working. Filled both to top, couldn't use after one use. Had to switch rooms after unpacking all.

Overall a great stay. The shared bathrooms are no problem as it is only with one other room. Front desk lady who greeted us most often was very nice and was patient with my poor German skills. However, housekeeping did come into the room once without even knocking first. So that was strange.

During our trip to Zurich with my wife, we stayed in this hotel for two days. The reception was very good. When we arrived, I realized that I had mistakenly reserved a room with a shared bathroom, but the reception changed the room for us at our request. The hotel was located in a great and quiet neighborhood with close access to the tram, shops and restaurants. The rooms were very clean and they had a good breakfast. Thank you for the hospitality of the hotel

Just 19 minutes away from the airport
Definitely my favorite Shul/Minyan factory in the EU, very welcoming, like the Schtiebels in BoroPark!!!!!
Very welcoming people. Was there for one shabbat. Recommend if you stay in Zurich.

Stayed for 3 months here in Comfort Apartment.  Great location and fair price (during covid in 2021).  Since I stayed longer I didn’t expect “hotel like” service so it was completely fine.  My key didn’t work one time and I called the manager and he showed up right away.  Automated check-in can be confusing for the first time.  They provide cleaning once a week but sometimes the cleaning ladies show up late or in different days.

The location (in Weststrasse) is top.  Many bars and great restaurants nearby.

I would strongly suggest to stay here if you are planning to stay longer and didn’t expect hotel/Airbnb like service.

Clean bed sheets, but dirty bathroom (hair, bugs, grime), stained furniture, damaged light fixtures. Room smelled like cigarettes. I didn't even attempt to use the shower, and instead used the shower at my workplace gym.

Good location, plenty of restaurant options within walking distance.

They tried to enter my room 30 minutes before the scheduled checkout time. First they rung the doorbell, and after a couple seconds of me not answering they unlocked the door with their key card. While the door does auto-lock, there was no mechanism to lock the door from the inside. Luckily, I blocked the door with a chair every night before bed, so they were unable to get in. I'm giving them two stars for service because they were polite and let me check in early. However, I would not stay here again.

Most likely would not stay here again. Self check in was difficult and no one answered the phone when called. Cold in the apartment as the hot water radiators simply did not work. Great to find some where with 3 rooms close to everything. Felt uncomfortable the whole time we were there.

The stay at Living Downtown, Weststrase 146, is probably the worst stay I've ever experienced in my entire life.

My family and I need two children beds for our stay, which I requested 2,5 months before arrival. It took the "office" several weeks to answer and they sent a price together with a link that said "Accept offer". The link didn't work, whence I wrote back to get the beds confirmed or to get a new link. After several more weeks we received a mail completely similar to the first one that didn't work and responded the link didn't work, but we would like to confirm that we needed beds for the children.
When we arrived there were no such beds, we then called the office who tolds ud, that the would bring the beds within 30 minutes. They didn't arrive, nor did they let us know, that they couldn't make it.

The appartement was completey under-equipped when it comes to cutlery and furniture. It was disgustingly dirty with matts of dust on many panels, garbage under the madresses and a nasty, smelly bathroom drain. The washing machine was completely broken and couldn't do any programmes. It only had (very bright) ceiling lights i.e no small / night lamps.

The "office" is close to impossible to reach and you will only find one person in the entire company who knows english. When actually reaching this person, he will let you know that "You can call any time, we will be ready to meet your requirements", but then ignore every following call you make during weekdays on all the numbers, that they use.

Here is a non exhaustive list of things that were not satisfactory about our stay:
1) Close to none customers service
2) Dishonest employees, with only one english speaking person (who is almost impossible to reach)
3) Filthy apartment, indluding dusty panels and closets, stained chairs, garbage under madresses, smelly bath drain
4) Check in at the front door using the screen was not possible
5) Multiple radiators were turned on with no thermostat mounted, whence heating and impossible to turn off.
6) Broken toilet seat
7) Tons of cutlery missing, including knifes, forks, plates, cutting boards, bowl, chefs knife, frying pan, oven gloves, etc
8) Tons of missing furniture including chairs with back support, night lamps, a regularly sized table
9) Broken washing machine
10) Broken window screen

When we made the firm aware of these missing / broken things they got to the appartment only bringing a toy sized frying pan with room for 1 egg, mounted only one thermostat, and brought a bowl for salad. They rudely declined the price reduction proposal that we made.

I advise all travellers and people on business trips to STAY AWAY form Living Downtown.

My friends and I spent a few days in this place and been quite disappointed...
We found a dirty sock on the chair in the kitchen, dead insects by the bed. We had book for 4 people but only 3 towels were provided.
You can barely open the door to the balcony and it's full of trash around it.
But the worst part is that I forgot a Prada dust bag and a backpack in one of the wardrobe's drawer. I sent an email the next day, pretty sure that the housekeeper found it while cleaning the apartment. The manager said that they would check it out. At the end of the days still haven't heard from them, so I send another email, the next day they still haven't answered me, so I'm emailing again to make sure they have seen my message,waiting all day to get a response but nothing so I had to call them! The manager seemed quite uncomfortable telling me that the housekeeper is 100% sure that there was nothing in the wardrobe... My stuff had just magically disappeared...

Good food but we've had better indian food before. Daal was amazing and paneer Tikka masala seemed like butter paneer to us and it was alright, wouldn't get it again. The young guy serving us was quite timid could barely hear him unfortunately. Not too talkative either. Would come back and try different dishes.

Restaurant is in decent place. Atmosphere is okay but the food was bad. They served half cooked food. Curry taste was also very mediocre. When we complained about that, the waiter said that is the best they can provide. Felt arrogance. Hopefully, they will take care of cooking and hospitality in future.
One of the best vegetarian Indian restaurants I've visited. Customer service was fantastic. The food was spot on. Very tasty. Highly recommended.

I went to Masala for lunch with a colleague and I was really impressed.
I lived in London for many years where there are many good Indian restaurants so my expectations weren’t too high. That said, I found a really great and attentive customer service, good food, fair prices and most importantly plenty of vegan options.

I would highly recommend Masala and I will definitely go back soon.

Lunch Buffet is very good! Big assortment of plates.
For take away the Vegan-Based Chicken Bombay roll is also very good, spicy & delicious!
Actually a great place to stop and grab snacks or lunch. But please get your system ready to scan Supercard again.
Small and convenient place to get things.
They are the one open much earlier than other store if you wanna grab coffee or pastry in the morning rush
Quick, clean and provides all the food you need for the day
Decent supply of items.
The store has a lot of goods and little space. Therefore, it is inconvenient to move around the store. However, there is a large assortment, so you can easily find what you need. I recommend
Pretty good.  Fruit looked fairly fresh. Store was clean. The location of some items seemed odd but otherwise decent store.

Great place. Everything you would need to eat, of course some bathroom stuff etc and other basic needs things. Fast service. I would recommend the long tuna sandwich at the To-go. The pizzas also delicious
quite expensive compared to aldi, lidl and denner but sometimes they offer better discounts.

Not much of a choice for vegans.
Thanks for the Answer! True! I'm seeing more vegan goodies novadays, keep on pushing in the right direction 🌱👏 and please add more Organic options too 🌱
Wonderful service. A pleasure to shop. Clean. Bought kosher alpine cheese.
Best supermarket to stock up for Alps trips! Lots of high-quality European kosher products.
Nice kosher shopping mall. Good foods and drinks and big variety of food. Also has good wine.
Easy 5 stars, Kosher, clean and excellent service. As a side note they have an excellent Pesach variety!!!
Great store with a great selection, everything come with a glat kosher.
Very friendly, great opening hours but yeah, its a coop pronto so you will only find a bit of the main take-away things..
Ok place it has croissants,cereal bars, chewing gum, packaged food and just a very good place if u are hungry and in a rush
Small....but has the essentials...
Good product

The STAFF is a disaster!! One of them in particular is constantly confrontational!
They don't even know German and try to lecture customers and are aggressive! Provocative attitude and no customer service in mind at all. As always, Coop (pronto) is of course not interested, customer service at COOP is also a disaster. The umbrella company should take a closer look at such franchisees.

Updated Review with few other stores review
Chocolates sold at this place which is at 21 Swiss will cost you 29 USD in Duty Free Dubai and 26 Euro in Munich Duty Free. So i guess its a good discount. Based on my latest visit to these stores

Do not find much discounts but higher discounts on big bag of chocolates. Over all good experience.

Very cheap but the quality is not great. The variety is good but there are not many healthy, vegetarian/vegan options. They have a lot of alcohol though, also for a rather cheap price.
It is also good for buying things in bulk (mainly snacks and drinks).
Service is great and a large variety of brand name products
This place works fine, but it's just too cramped. You can't almost pass each other when going opposite way between the isles. But otherwise .. they've got stuff I need, so it's ok.
Good prices for Switzerland. Well set out store. Own brand chocolate is excellent.

Good Chinese supermarket in Zurich. They have a decent assortment. I'm checking out different asian stores in Zurich to find the one with the most selections and this was not bad. It was my first time in this asian shop and what I like the most is that the staff are friendly and nice. They were helpful with all of my questions and even let me use their toilet. It was a positive experience and I could recommend it.
Good variety of Asian food. The fresh product selection is quite good!

Good mix of spices, frozen foods, some fresh and a wide range of sweet and savory snacks. And they have pre-made bubble tea!? Overall, the best Chinese supermarket I've found in Zürich so far. There is also a range of cooking and serving things too, if you are preparing a banquet.
Limited parking is available in the back streets opposite, and it is close to public transport.

Ohhh this place makes me homesick! Many original goods from Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore that I used to see every single day. These are some selections of herbs that we often incorporate in Chinese traditional medicine, and even dedicated cooker for them. To buy rice, I would prefer coming here. The taste of Taiwanese and Japanese has been recognised as top, if not the best, of the world. Their texture is also better than, say, Thai or Indian rice, in terms of stickiness and firmness. Definitely the top option if you are to make sushi or onigiri (rice ball).
Nice shop. I always like the dumplings we buy there. We also discovered vapor cooking due to this shop.
The store is within walking distance of my house so I shop there often. There are self-service cash registers. Everything seems to suit me, I recommend it.
Well-stocked, spacious and relatively quiet.

A very clean, bright and tidy Coop, with a wide variety of food, drinks, wine, shampoos and shower gels. Although house appliances have smaller range of choices. I like to come here because it's always not very crowded.
Is a pretty big supermarket but they change everything and now they have less products for the household
Big sized coop with a very wide variety of produce!

I've bought here only three times, three things; wine leaves, yufka, fish. Wine leaves were like paper, hard so I gave them feedback so maybe they don't buy that brand anymore. They reacted defensive and blamed me. Yufka had mold, they gave money back. Fish was inedible, went to trash bin. Was I just unlucky? Friends say they have good fruits and veggies though. My experience was never ever good sadly.
Super unfriendly. It's apparantly o  the customer to buy enough product to ensure thos store's balance to be positive. You ger scolded for not buying enough. Wth

Very oraganized and have a good variety of groceries. And the fair lady is so welcoming and so nice. Actually their prices are exceptionally low. Also you can have fresh fruits and vegetables. Thank you.
Love this place! Clean, friendly and super selection of fruits and vegetables. One of the few places that allow to buy without plastic bags. Right price for good quality.

They sell rotten avocados. 3 out of 3 were totally rotten.

Lex Fridman.text: Nestled in a vibrant neighborhood of Zürich, this area exudes a lively and diverse atmosphere. With a plethora of dining options and cozy bars like Plüsch just a short walk away, residents can easily unwind and socialize. The convenience of having essential amenities like grocery stores and schools within reach adds a sense of community and practicality to the area.

Real estate agent.text: Nestled in a vibrant neighborhood with approximately 26,287 residents, this area exudes a lively and diverse atmosphere. With a plethora of dining options, including a charming restaurant La Côte just an 8-minute walk away, residents can easily indulge in culinary delights. The neighborhood also boasts convenient amenities like a well-equipped gym, multiple grocery stores, and efficient public transportation, ensuring a dynamic and convenient lifestyle for its inhabitants.

neutral without emphasis.text: Nestled within a bustling community of approximately 26,287 residents, this neighborhood exudes a sense of everyday convenience and accessibility.
